benchmark_details.name: OrdRankBen (Ordinal Ranking Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: OrdRankBen is a novel benchmark designed to capture multi-granularity relevance distinctions in natural language processing by incorporating structured ordinal labels, facilitating a more precise evaluation of ranking models.
benchmark_details.data_type: document ranking and passage ranking pairs

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of ranking models using ordinal relevance scores.

data.size: 678,100 pairs for passage ranking; 579,300 pairs for document ranking
data.annotation: Ordinal relevance labels assigned based on structured criteria where scores represent degrees of relevance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on ordinal relevance scores that reflect varying degrees of relevance.
methodology.interpretation: Cherishing the capacity of models to distinguish multi-granularity differences in relevance.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across multiple models for ranking tasks.
